text: The Victorian Centenary Grand Prix was a motor race staged at the Phillip Island circuit in Victoria, Australia on Saturday, 27 October 1934.Thrilling Grand Prix won by Mick Smith, The Argus, Monday, 29 October 1934, page 7 The 230 mile race, which was organised by the Australian Racing Drivers Club, was contested on a handicap basis. The race was the richest and the longest that had been held in the state of Victoria to that time, and was the first road race in Australia to be open to "catalogued racing and sports cars of all powers".Centenary Grand Prix - Conditions of entry, The Argus, Tuesday, 4 September 1934, page 11 Of the 22 starters, eight finished within the limit of 25 minutes after the winner. The race was won by Mick Smith, competing under the name “Gardner”, and driving a Ford V8 Roadster. The Grand Prix was an official event on the centenary program Roads to glory, Australian Hot Rodder, Number Four, pages 66 to 69, www.australianhotrodder.com.au Retrieved on 27 March 2015 commemorating Edward Henty’s 1834 settlement at Portland, which led to the founding of the state of Victoria.Peter Maltezos, 1934-35 Centenary of Victoria and Melbourne, Tuesday, 16 April 2013, urban.melbourne ==Results== Mick Smith won the Victorian Centenary Grand Prix driving a 1934 Ford V8 Roadster {| class="wikitable" generated with :de:Wikipedia:Helferlein/VBA- Macro for EXCEL tableconversion V1.7<\hiddentext> |- style="font-weight:bold" | height="14" align="center" | Position | Driver | align="center" | No. | Car | Entrant Centenary Grand Prix, The Argus, Tuesday, 2 October 1934, page 5 | align="center" | Handicap Centenary Grand Prix, The Argus, Saturday, 27 October 1934, page 7 | align="center" | Race Time | align="center" | Laps |- | height="14" align="center" | 1 | "Gardner" (Mick Smith) | align="center" | 11 | Ford V8 Roadster | "Gardner" | align="center" | 18m 5s | align="center" | 3:07:56 | align="center" | 35 |- | height="14" align="center" | 2 | Les Murphy | align="center" | 18 Victorian Centenary Grand Prix : dynamic performance in 230 mile race calls forth these sincere tributes / Leggetts, trove.nla.gov.au Retrieved 3 February 2020 | MG P Type Midget | Lane's Motors | align="center" | 35m 35s | align="center" | 3:28:35 | align="center" | 35 |- | height="14" align="center" | 3 | Ted McLean | align="center" | | Salmson | T.
